title: Advanced Data Filtering in R using dplyr
text:
In this video I show you advanced uses of the filter() function from the dplyr R package.
We will see different ways of keeping or removing specific rows of a dataset using 5 simple examples. Then we will explore more advanced filtering methods, such as filtering data using logical conditions on multiple columns, how to remove missing values or how to use specific words or strings to filter rows of character variables.

üëã Hi there!


My name is F√©lix Luginb√ºhl. I‚Äôm a Data Scientist and R Developer. I build tools and apps (mostly with R) to automate data analysis, share insights and improve decision making.

title: F√©lix Luginb√ºhl
text:
Get the code
Join my newsletter to download all the R scripts of my blog posts and YouTube videos.


Once you subscribed you will receive an automatic email with the URL of my GitHub repository, where you can download all the code.

title: F√©lix Luginb√ºhl
text:
Let‚Äôs do something together!

  
    Web apps
  
  
    Automated reports
  
  
    R Training
  


  
    Get insightful and fully customized web applications. I build engaging and interactive dashboards, which centralize your insights and data with zero software licensing costs attached.
    Examples ‚Üí
  
  
    Increase productivity, save time and reduce human error. From data importing to report generation, data analysis are generated in seconds rather than days. It can be a game changer for your decision-making process.
    Examples ‚Üí
  
  
    Learn R programming and make the most of your data. Liberate you from Excel and expensive softwares. Learn R, the most used statistical programming language in the world.
    Examples ‚Üí
  

If you‚Äôre interested in working with me, please drop me a line at felixanalytix@gmail.com

title: aniview app
text: Application

title: Swiss City Statistics
text:
What is it about?
Choose an indicator, two cities, and have fun trying to guess which city has the highest indicator value.


Data Info
The Swiss City Statistics dataset contains +400 indicators about 9 Swiss cities and their agglomerations.
The data is queried using the BFS R package.


The Application

title: Make Beautiful Tables using R
text:
Would you like to learn how to create more engaging and better looking tables using the R programming language?
I just release a new YouTube video showing you how to access Spotify data to get the top 10 most listen songs and visualize them on a table.
You will learn how to:

title: Make Beautiful Tables using R
text: Visualisations

title: Read, Clean and Merge Excel files using R
text:
Do you want to know how to create R loops that read hundreds of Excel files into R?
And that your R loops clean, validate and even merge your Excel files data into a single and consolidated dataset?
Well, you are lucky‚Ä¶ My new video just teaches you how to do that üòâ. And in only 5 minutes. So be sure to check it out:

title: Geocode ANY location using R
text:
Do you have a list of places/locations and you would like to visualize them on an interactive map?
In my new YouTube video, I show you how to use geocoding services such as Google Maps, Bing, Mapbox or OpenStreetMap to get the latitude and longitude of any location and plot them on an interactive map.

title: Geocode ANY location using R
text: Visualisation

title: Google Sheet Automation using R
text:
Would you like to learn how to connect R to your Google Drive and automate the data processing of your Google Sheets?
I just published a new YouTube video showing the basics of working with Google Sheets data using R programming.
You will learn how to:

Connect R to Google Drive and list your existing Sheets.
Write and read Google Sheets from R.
Append data to a Google Sheet.
Rename a worksheet.
Change file access permission (from private to public).

Check it out:

title: Interactive Country Maps with R
text:
Would you like to learn how to create interactive maps of any European country at a district level using R?
In this new YouTube video I show you how to map Switzerland at a regional level using Eurostat geodata. But these steps can be used for any European country.
You will learn how to:
Check out the video now:

title: Interactive Country Maps with R
text: Visualisation

title: Interactive Network of the Marvel Universe
text:
Let‚Äôs have some fun creating an interactive network of the Marvel Cinematic Universe using R programming.
First we will scrape the data from Wikipedia, structure the data in a tidy way, and build an interactive network of the main Marvel characters.
You can play with the final interactive network here.
Learn how to make it by yourself watching the video:

title: Interactive Network of the Marvel Universe
text: Visualisation

title: Map ANY region of the world using R
text:
Would you like to learn how to create beautiful maps of any region of the world using the R programming language?
I just published a new YouTube video showing you how to create a choropleth world map using World Bank unemployment data, and how to zoom on any specific region. As an example, we will visualize the European region only.
But of course, you can reuse the R code showed in the video with your own dataset on any region of your choice.
At the end of the video I discuss some important points regarding the use of the scale and the color palette when creating a map, so be sure to watch the video until the end.

title: How to Detect Emotions üòçüò≠üò± from Texts
text:
Would you like to know how to extract the main emotions from any text and visualize its emotional trajectory using the R programming language?
And learn this in a fun way?
In this new YouTube video, we will implement a simple-but-efficient method (a lexicon-based sentiment analysis) generally used to analyse consumer feedbacks, social medias or texts in surveys. But, to make it more fun, we will instead analyse the book Nineteen Eighty-Four from George Orwell.
Be sure to check out the video:

title: How to Detect Emotions üòçüò≠üò± from Texts
text: Visualisations

title: Beautiful World Maps using R
text:
Do you want to learn how to create beautiful world maps using R programming?
In this video I show you how to download world map data, plot it, add texts and colors, and even change the map projection using the R packages {ggplot2} and {sf}.
Be sure to check it out:

title: Beautiful World Maps using R

title: BFS R package - Search and download data from the Swiss Federal Statistical Office
text: The BFS R package allows to explore and access Swiss public data in a dynamic and reproducible way. Users can discover the latest BFS datasets available, extract their metadata and download them in any language (German, French, Italian or English) directly from the R console.
